stoic.name: Stoic
stoic.description: Speaks plainly and without emotion. Short sentences. Rarely uses contractions or slang. Common for disciplined, serious, emotionally reserved characters.

sarcastic.name: Sarcastic
sarcastic.description: Uses irony, exaggerated compliments, and passive-aggressive jabs. Great for witty or bitter personalities with high temper or low trust.

formal.name: Formal
formal.description: Very polite, complete sentences, avoids slang. May sound academic or noble. Perfect for nobles, knights, or scholarly NPCs.

gruff.name: Gruff
gruff.description: Rough, blunt, clipped speech. May sound tired, old, or grumpy. Common with blacksmiths, mercenaries, or loners.

cheerful.name: Cheerful
cheerful.description: Upbeat, optimistic, friendly tone. Uses exclamation points and playful language. Best for helpful, extroverted, or high-likability NPCs.

cryptic.name: Cryptic
cryptic.description: Speaks in riddles, metaphors, or poetic phrasing. May be vague or mystical.  Ideal for seers, alchemists, druids, or NPCs with high curiosity + low empathy.

military.name: Military
military.description: Commanding, concise, and tactical. No-nonsense. May use ranks or orders. Use with guards, generals, or disciplined NPCs with high pride + respect.

childlike.name: Childlike
childlike.description: Simple, emotional, sometimes naive. Uses sound effects, giggles, or exaggeration. Works for younger or innocent characters, or comic relief NPCs.
